channel.title: Fedup on purpleidea.com
channel.description: Recent content in Fedup on purpleidea.com

item.title: Upgrading from Fedora 18 to Fedora 19
item.description: It was time to take the plunge and upgrade from Fedora 18 to Fedora 19. Fedora 18 was one of the worst releases ever, so I figured it could only get better. I ran my backups as usual, however this time I didn’t seem to need them, the upgrade process went off without a hitch! I used the fedup-cli process over the network. I always run these things inside of screen.

item.title: Picking up the pieces after a Fedora 18 install
item.description: I love GNOME and Fedora, but “upgrading” from Fedora 17 to 18 did not go well for me. I recommend you wait until either these are all fixed, or Fedora 19+ suits your needs. Here are a list of problems I had, and some workarounds. Hopefully proper patches to these bugs will get merged quickly, so that you don’t need to use these fixes. Problem: Boot fails after upgrade from Fedora 17 to Fedora 18.
